meanings.definition: To illegally seize control of a vehicle, especially an airplane, by force.
meanings.sent1: The criminals were highjacking the plane, causing panic among the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The news reported a case where someone attempted highjacking a ship in the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The movie plot involved a comical highjacking of a hot air balloon by a clumsy thief.
meanings.sent4: The virus was highjacking the computer system, spreading chaos and confusion.
meanings.sent5: The storm was highjacking the sailboat, steering it off course into dangerous waters.
